newsitem.title: USA: United Waste files for 3 mln shr offering.
newsitem.headline: United Waste files for 3 mln shr offering.

text.p: United Waste Systems Inc Thursday said it filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a public offering of three million shares of its common stock.

The offering is being made pursuant to a shelf registration previously filed by the company with the SEC. None of the directors, officers or other stockholders of the company are selling any shares in the offering.

The offering will be managed by Goldman Sachs & Co, Merrill Lynch & Co, and Deutsche Morgan Grenfell. The company has granted the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional 450,000 shares to cover over-allotments.
Proceeds of the offering will be used to reduce outstanding indebtedness under the company's $190 million revolving credit facility, to fund acquisitions and for general corporate purposes.
United Waste Systems is a solid waste management company and currently owns or operates 35 landfills, 59 collection companies and 66 transfer stations.
